intro: Jacobinia chrysostephana, commonly known as the golden stephania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Jacobinia chrysostephana is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
